job_info.role_description: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling; collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability; participate in the training and fine-tuning of models to improve accuracy and efficiency; conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques and contribute to proof-of-concept development; document model development, research, and performance metrics for future reference and learning; collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and provide AI/ML-driven solutions; assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models, ensuring they are scalable and efficient; assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models for various business applications

soft_skills: Ability to work effectively in a team environment

preferred_skills: Understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms
Exposure to AI/ML through academic projects, internships, or online courses
job_responsibilities: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling
Collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability
Participate in the training and fine-tuning of models to improve accuracy and efficiency
Conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques and contribute to proof-of-concept development
Document model development, research, and performance metrics for future reference and learning
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and provide AI/ML-driven solutions
Assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models, ensuring they are scalable and efficient
Assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models for various business applications

questions.question: In pandas, which method is best for replacing every occurrence of “missing” with NaN in a DataFrame column?
2. You want to one-hot encode a categorical column while keeping the original DataFrame intact. What scikit-learn class should you use?
3. Which Keras callback automatically stops training early if validation loss stops improving?
4. In TensorFlow 2.x, how do you turn off eager execution to use graph mode?
5. Which SQL clause is required to compute the average salary per department?
6. You have a PyTorch tensor `x` of shape (32, 3, 64, 64). How do you reorder the dimensions to (32, 64, 64, 3)?
7. Which Git command safely discards uncommitted changes in your working directory?
8. To reduce overfitting in a RandomForestClassifier, which hyperparameter should you increase?
9. When fine-tuning a pre-trained BERT model for text classification, which layers are typically frozen?

options.text: Early transformer blocks, fine-tuning later ones

questions.question: 10. In scikit-learn, which transformer is best for scaling numeric features to the 0–1 range?
11. Which TensorFlow utility lets you save model checkpoints every epoch with a descriptive filename?
12. You want to perform a left outer join between DataFrames `df1` and `df2` on the column `id`. Which pandas statement is correct?
13. Which PyTorch loss function is best for multi-class classification with integer targets?
14. In Git, you accidentally committed to main but meant to create a feature branch. Which sequence moves the commit to a new branch and reverts main?

options.text: git branch feature && git reset --soft HEAD~1
git checkout -b feature && git reset --hard HEAD~1
git stash && git checkout -b feature && git stash pop
git cherry-pick main onto feature && git revert main

questions.question: 15. Which Keras preprocessing layer vectorizes text into integer sequences of fixed length?
